key_points: Anderson Cooper addressed Chris Cuomo's firing from CNN, emphasizing the importance of ethics in journalism.
Cooper expressed feeling 'terrible' for Cuomo and his family but highlighted the 'repercussions' for not adhering to journalistic ethics.
The firing occurred after a third-party investigation into Cuomo's conduct regarding allegations made against his brother, former New York Governor Andrew Cuomo.
Cooper denied prior knowledge of Cuomo's termination before the public announcement on December 4.
The termination was a surprise to many, according to Cooper, despite previous discussions about Cuomo's potential conflicts of interest.
Anderson Cooper had not spoken to fellow CNN anchor Don Lemon since the firing, but Andy Cohen was the first to contact him about the news.
Andy Cohen jokingly inquired about obtaining Cuomo's former show following the news of the firing.
Cuomo was initially suspended by CNN on November 30, prior to his termination, due to his involvement with his brother's response to sexual harassment allegations.
Upon Cuomo's firing, CNN stated that 'additional information has come to light' but did not provide further details.
A new allegation of sexual misconduct against Chris Cuomo was reported, stemming from his time at another network.
